name: Comfort Inn Manhattan Bridge

reviews.text: I come to NY every couple years and i'm always looking for a cheap and clean place to stay in the city. I was told that this hotel is relatively new and decided to give it a try - good thing i did! It was clean, the staff was courteous, and above all location - location - location! This hotel is located between Chinatown and Little Italy. Within a short walking distance, there are several places to eat (Chinese, Italian, fast food places, etc), a couple of different subway stops, and steps away from the foot of the Manhattan Bridge. If you're a foodie there are several great restaurants, and famous ice cream & gelato places to try!
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: The hotel has revelead a very good choice: the position is really convenient (located near the lines B and D and, some minutes away, even the brown lines J and Z), safe and almost quiet (though you certainly have to realize that it is not as fancy as the 5th avenue!).
reviews.title: A little gem

reviews.text: We stayed here for a long weekend in mid-April and we enjoyed it immensely. My wife and I were traveling with her best friend so the desk agent gave us connecting rooms on the 6th floor. We loved our room. It was in the back of the hotel but it was on a corner so we had a lot of privacy. For how small the cozy the hotel is, our room was a decent size. The bathroom was huge and very nice. Everything was very clean. The rest of the hotel was also quite compact but they do such a good job of geting everything in that it doesn't seem so small. The breakfast area on the first floor just fits but it does the job. I also thought the breakfast was pretty good for a hotel breakfast. A great thing about this hotel was the fact that the Grand St. subway station is just a block and a half away. That was key as we were in town to see the band Furthur at the Beacon on the UWS. We only had to change once to get there. That was fantastic.
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel in Manhattan, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did experience some fellow guests on our floor that were extremely loud, constantly going in and out of their room and letting the door slam. Turns out it was kids. My wife's best friend requested they try to be considerate a bit more and that was the end of the constant banging. That was very nice of them. Other than that, the staff was very pleasant.
reviews.title: Convenient and clean

reviews.text: The hotel is located right at the foot of the Manhattan Bridge so there tends to be quite a bit of traffic flowing off into lower Manhattan. Oh, it's also right smack in the middle of Chinatown so it would help big time if you could read characters since literally everything in sight is in Chinese characters. But don't fret, Little Italy is just 2-3 blocks to the East. There are tons of great restaurants there. Also Nolita isn't that far and there are a ton of good restaurants and bars there.
reviews.title: Very Nice! Would stay again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One little great place I found for breakfast and lunch (sandwiches) is a little old school diner called the Cup & Saucer (80 Canal St. - Eldridge and Canal Sts.). It's an old time diner still putting the spread out daily. I had great breakfasts and lunches from that spot and they usually threw in a free donut or bear claw. If you need something in a jiffy, that's the spot.
reviews.title: Good value, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price, spacious clean. With a view of the bridge. Simple breakfast. In the heart of Chinatown with European clientele. We will stay there again.
reviews.title: Good hotel, shame about the bed

reviews.text: forgot to review this when i got back - went for st patricks day 2011 for 7nights - had a fab time hotel was great clean comfortable bathroom spotless and room size was fine - stayed on 14th floor which had great views of the bridge - the free breakfast was great and a fab way to start of ur day in the big apple - loved the free wifi as it allowed me to keep in contact with family for free - we arrived at 1pm and got checked in straight away and when we were leaving they kept our bags for us and organised a private taxi to take us to the airport - great hotel at a fantastic price wld defo recommend to friends and family and would return
reviews.title: great time at comfort inn

reviews.text: This hotel is conveniently located near Manhattan bridge and Grand subway. It's located right amidst the Chinatown markets and inter-city bus agents, making it quite crowded nearby. Breakfast offered was good although I've had much better service in much economical hotels. My wife and I wanted to have a quick 3 day view of Manhattan and this was totally worth the money.
reviews.title: Great location but not so good service

reviews.text: Decent hotel for the price although very odd location
reviews.title: Decent hotel for the price

reviews.text: Packed between buildings in Chinatown, this hotel was nicer than I expected. Clean, larger rooms (for NYC), nice comfortable bed, spacious shower. It even had a little table and desk with a chair. Perfect for my daughter and me as it was her first trip to the Big Apple. The streets around the hotel were a little dirty as debris from the produce markets would spill out onto them. The staff a the hotel were very kind and helpful, especially Ivan, who escorted us to the roof of the hotel for some amazing views of the city and a great photo op. The Grand Street Subway was an easy walk and Little Italy was also located close enough for walking.
reviews.title: Better Than Expected

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the hotel, it truly is a hidden gem tucked away in the chaos of Chinatown. The elevator was down a few times but that was the only bad thing I can say. The staff, breakfast, lobby, location, cleanliness- all EXCELLENT. I will be telling everyone I know about this diamond in the rough! Thanks for being so accommodating with the bed in the loft :) See ya soon the South Carolina and Florida Crew...
reviews.title: Very Convenient :)

reviews.text: The area directly around the hotel is a little grimy but the location is really great for the price. The staff were really helpful, the price includes good wi-fi in the rooms and breakfast and the hotel is pretty new so our room was spotless. It's only a 10 minute walk to Soho and Greenwich Village and even less to the Lower East Side. There are plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance and the subway is one block away. It's a good choice if you want to be near Soho etc but can't afford to stay there.
reviews.title: Great location and price

reviews.text: Staff was wonderful, ready to help when needed. We arrived at the hotel way too early for check-in and they kept our bags in a designated room.
reviews.title: Great deal, great view

reviews.text: Like many rooms in New York City, the room was small. For example, the chair for the desk was right against the bed. When not using the desk, though, there was a spot for the chair which didn't impinge on space. There was also an easy chair in the room. The bed was as high as Mount Everest so had to actually climb onto it. Once in the bed, it was extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: A fine start for the trip of a lifetime

description: The Comfort Inn® Manhattan Bridge hotel is ideally located in the Lower Eastside of New York City, providing easy access to all the best this area offers. Local points of interest like the Manhattan Bridge, Chinatown, Little Italy, the New York City Financial District, Wall Street and Ground Zero are all within walking distance from this New York City, NY hotel. Additional attractions include: -Jacob K. Javits Convention Center -Broadway Theater District -Rockefeller Center -United Nations -Times Square New York is easy to explore thanks to this hotel's close proximity to subway and train stations. Countless entertainment venues, world-class shopping opportunities and unique eateries can be found in the vicinity.
